flow.descriptionCdata:
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.1f73d2fe-2c00-441a-952d-12c3df33fc4b.description=
Evaluates several XPath expressions from 'parameters' against a given 'xml' and creates variables in the local context with the XPath values.
Each XPath expression result is treated as a string.
 
Inputs\:
xml - The xml (in the form of a String).
parameters - A Java properties file formatted list of variable names and corresponding xpath expressions.

Responses\:
success - Everything worked.
failure - Something went wrong.
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.20ffbb80-acbc-4997-80b7-a8e4af880166.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.63a8eabb-1faa-43ec-8b8f-1978920e9313.description=
This subflow was create by the Web Services Wizard to invoke the TicketServiceBeanBinding - getSiteResponsibilityContactInfooperation on http\://10.12.14.223\:18030/oss-ticket-core-1/TicketServiceBean?wsdl

Inputs\:
host - The Host that is running the web service
port - The Port that host running the web service on
logicalSiteId - the input named\: getSiteResponsibilityContactInfo|logicalSiteId of the complex type\: getSiteResponsibilityContactInfo
physicalSiteId - the input named\: getSiteResponsibilityContactInfo|physicalSiteId of the complex type\: getSiteResponsibilityContactInfo

Responses\:
success - The SOAP command was accepted by the web service
failure - Something went wrong while making the SOAP request

Extra Results\:
document - The Raw XML Response of the Web Service
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.7d32eb64-f97f-4070-ac9b-d8354d744da0.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against.
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.b537d67e-dfd3-475a-8634-e69a4f0842a6.description=
This is an operation that does nothing, and can be used to display information to the user by editing the display tab. It can also be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs, and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.description=
This operation gets the emailAddress, firstName, lastName, city and state based on the physical and logical site id's and validates emailAddress.
 If its a valid emailaddress and if the flow is running in production then email is sent to the customer.
 If its a valid emailaddress and if the flow is running in test environment then email is sent to the test email address.

Inputs\:
physical site id - the physical site EX\: ZDATHZ
logical site id - the locaical site Ex\: S236303
ticket - ticket id
summary - summary of the event
objectName - cmdbName of the event

Outputs\:
emailAddress - email address of the person responsible on the logical site
firstName - first name of the person responsible on the physical site
lastName - last name of the person responsible on the physical site

Responses\:
success - If everything went fine.
failure - If something went wrong.
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.f96e51da-2667-499f-9cdf-21d39ef035d0.description=
This operation validates email address is in correct format.

Inputs\:
emailAddress - email address

Responses\:
success - If everything went fine.
failure - If something went wrong.
781a586b-6c3b-4b21-9970-24b2e88c7905.fdea5e0f-a8fb-46b7-bcde-9f5447dacab1.description=
This is an operation that does nothing, and can be used to display information to the user by editing the display tab. It can also be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs, and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
flow.name: ProcessSendNotification

staticBinding.value: Savvis Case: ${ticket} - MS SQL Job Failure

${firstName} ${lastName},

SAVVIS received the below SQL alert for device ${objectName} and has created case ${ticket} to track the incident.

${summary}

Please investigate this issue. You may contact the SAVVIS Service Desk at 888-638-6771 option 1 or reply to this email for additional assistance. This case has been set to auto-close in 48 hours.

You may create a case, check case status and provide updates online at www.savvisstation.com.
